article: Not too long ago, a story that happened at Walt Disney touched me greatly. A guest _ out of our Polynesian Village resort at Walt Disney was asked how she _ her visit. She told the front-desk clerk she had had a(n) _ vacation, but was heartbroken about _ several rolls of Kodak color film she had not yet _ . At that moment she was particularly _ over the loss of the pictures she had shot at our Polynesian Luau, _ this was a memory she especially treasured. Now, please understand that we have no written service rules _ lost photos in the park. _ , the clerk at the front desk _ Disney's idea of caring for our _ . She asked the woman to leave her a couple rolls of _ film, promising she would take care of the rest of our show at Polynesian Luau. Two weeks later the guest received a _ at her home. In it were photos of all the actors of our show, _ signed by each performer. There were also _ of the public procession and fireworks in the park, taken by the front-desk clerk in her own _ after work. I happened to know this _ because this guest wrote us a letter. She said that _ Excellent _ does not come from policy handbooks. It comes from people who _ --and from a culture that encourages and shapes that attitude.
